content.thinking: Let me analyze the document provided and extract the required information according to the schema. This appears to be a Colombian identification document, specifically a "Cédula de Ciudadanía" (Citizenship ID Card). Let me go through the document systematically: 1. Document Structure Analysis: - This is clearly an official Colombian government ID - It's a "Cédula de Ciudadanía" as indicated in the header - The document contains typical ID information including name, photo, number, etc. 2. Field Detection: - Header: "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" - Identifies country_issuer as Colombia - Document type: "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" - Identification type - "NUMERO": 1.018.460.087 - Identification number - "APELLIDOS": DIEGO FERNANDO - Last name (Note: this seems unusual as "Diego" is typically a first name, but I'll extract as shown) - "NOMBRES": [Signature appears here with "Diego F. Ovalle B."] - The name appears to be Ovalle Bayer Diego Fernando (with Ovalle Bayer as surname and Diego Fernando as given name) The back side shows additional information: - "FECHA DE NACIMIENTO": 16-JUN-1993 - Birth date - "LUGAR DE NACIMIENTO": MANI (CASANARE) - Height: 1.73 m - Blood type: O+ - Sex: M - "FECHA Y LUGAR DE EXPEDICION": 20-JUN-2011 BOGOTA D.C. - Date and place of issue 3. Extracting the fields according to the schema: - firstName: Looking at the structure, "DIEGO FERNANDO" appears under "APELLIDOS" which is unusual (as apellidos means surnames). However, looking at the complete document and the signature, it appears that "OVALLE BAYER" is the surname and "DIEGO FERNANDO" is the given name. This is confirmed by seeing "OVALLE BAYER" next to "NUMERO" which appears to be the surname. - lastName: "OVALLE BAYER" (appears as the main identifier after the number) - country_issuer: "Colombia" (clearly indicated in the document header "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA") - nationality: The document doesn't explicitly state nationality, but as this is a "Cédula de Ciudadanía" (citizenship ID), we can infer the nationality is Colombian. This follows our rule of defaulting to country_issuer when not explicitly stated. - identificationType: "Cédula de Ciudadanía" (clearly stated on the document) - identificationNumber: "1.018.460.087" (shown after "NUMERO") - message: No issues with the document, so this will be an empty string. Let me compile this information into the required JSON format. After closer examination of Colombian ID card formats, I believe: - The top line after NUMERO shows the surname (OVALLE BAYER) - Under APELLIDOS is DIEGO FERNANDO (which is unusual as these are typically first names) - Under NOMBRES there's a signature Let me reconsider: The Colombian "Cédula de Ciudadanía" format can be a bit confusing. In this document: - The number (NUMERO) is 1.018.460.087 - The line "OVALLE BAYER" appears to be the surname - Under APELLIDOS: DIEGO FERNANDO (which would be the given names) Looking at the signature, it appears to be "Diego F. Ovalle B." which would match with Diego Fernando as the given name and Ovalle Bayer as the surname. Therefore, I'm confident that: - firstName: "DIEGO FERNANDO" - lastName: "OVALLE BAYER" Let me now create the full JSON response.
